subject: Re: [junit] Classspath for ClassLoader
msgSnippet: on 12/20/00 7:13 AM, G Ramasubramani at grama@aztec.soft.net wrote: Paul, It is not a package problem as I am able to execute it using the textui.TestRunner.
messageBody:
Re: [junit] Classspath for ClassLoader on 12/20/00 7:13 AM, G Ramasubramani at grama@... wrote:

Paul,

       It is not a package problem as I am able to execute it using the textui.TestRunner. The problem appears when I try to cast a particular object as another Class. This casting goes through fine with the textui flavour, but gives a problem if I use any other flavour TestRunner. It appears that there are 2 class loaders at work here and hence the problem. If no one has come across this earlier or no one knows a possible resolution I might have to go through the TestRunner code - something which I don't want to do :-)

thanks,
Rama

A non-loading graphical test runner is available -- in JUnit 3.2 and earlier, junit.swingui.NonLoadingTestRunner will not reload classes.  Does that runner show the problem?

It seems to me that I've seen this before, and that the problem had to do, as you say, with hanging on to a reference to a class from one classloader and trying to cast to or from a class from another, although I can't remember quite how.  It is true, I think, that even if ClassA extends ClassB, ClassA from classloader 1 is incompatible with ClassB from classloader 2.
